title: Every champs runs for 1 minute, who would go the furthest.

replies.body: Sion. (Ultimate)
His ultimate lasts for 8 seconds and he has to run for 1 minute.  Rammus would go much further due to his low CD
Rammus's speed buff is pretty significant too. I remember building homeguard boots and getting over 1000 ms with Rammus.

Zilean
{{champion:26}}
Yi wins, He has one of the fastest to start with and he can just ult. Second guess is sivir, but thats with her ult.
His Ult doesn't last long enough for it to matter when Rammus and Zil can sustain their movespeed steriod
{{champion:64}}, because his base MS is somehow faster than {{champion:120}}...
None of his abilities give him a move speed steroid so his base ms wouldn't matter.
and he can't ward hop, and unless there's convenient monsters in the way his Q isn't helping either
Some of those people could teleport to their destination.

> [{quoted}](name=Dragonzzilla,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=pvEEcKFB,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2015-08-11T19:40:44.945+0000)
>
> Some of those people could teleport to their destination.

They can. But he said "RUN"
Depends on how you define 'run'.  Pantheon takes one giant leap, which could be considered a stride in his run.
A full minute? Rammus.
Not sure if {{champion:421}} counts.
{{champion:77}} Spam dem stances
TF wins.

Azir. Q -> E -> Q -> E etc.

Unless there are mana restrictions, where then Kennen would win with his energy and MS boost on his E.
Jax if he has enough wards.
Kassadin?  Doesn't say no abilities.
But they have to run. That wouldn't be running, but teleporting. You're right about the abilities they can be used, but they can't use anything that makes them teleport.
Technically Kassadin would be "riftwalking".  It is not a teleport, he is just bending space time so that he simply walks through a wormhole to a great distance :)
{{champion:4}} {{champion:98}} {{champion:223}} would go pretty damn far in the race if they could use their ultimates.

they actuallly wouldn't go that far in comparison to the champs with constant mobility. They have long CD on their ults and would get to use them early and get a big head start, but champs like {{champion:33}} {{champion:26}} would quickly close the gap with their short CD MS boosts. Also the channels do pose a problem and give up a lot of the ground that they would look to gain.
Shen would need an ally
{{champion:14}}  Hello.
Technically it would be Vel Koz, who has the fastest base movement speed at lvl 1. So without any abilities he would win. If it was with abilities then Zilean
{{champion:98}} . Ults ramus or whoever is winning, ~~taunts ramus, ramus follows BEHIND him to the finish line or whoever is winning~~ dash at the last second to win
It's FFA. You have no allies.
How do you taunt your ally?
Ok fine dashes ahead at the last second
Isn't Hecarim the fastest? Only being beaten by Udyr in bear form and Rammus doing his spin?
so... he's not the fastest.
idk mf maybe. she seems like she would go pretty far
Unless someone cheats and hits her.
{{champion:41}}  Barrel q run, out of barrels ult the enemy who is ahead of you.
janna
I'd say Janna, since she can blow the competition away, but everyone behind her would keep catching up.
{{champion:112}} : Take it from me. *I dare you.* {{item:3200}}
bard would win if he gets chimes to sustain his run.
{{champion:11}}  _gotta go fast_
Ult has too long of a CD for him to compare to {{champion:33}}  or {{champion:26}}

> [{quoted}](name=King Odarth,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=pvEEcKFB,comment-id=000b0000,timestamp=2015-08-11T20:55:58.772+0000)
>
> Ult has too long of a CD for him to compare to {{champion:33}}  or {{champion:26}}

Well, theoretically Rammus is rolling.
Master Yi, Quinn, Zilean, Janna, Miss Fortune, Teemo, Udyr. These would all do pretty well.
If teleporting ults are allowed then TF and sion compete, otherwise sion.
"run"
Ya I'd bet Zilean too. His MS buff and Rewind have a ridiculous uptime.
what hp is everyone at does ww get his w

yi
sivir
herc
rammus
zilean
